div.l: A fals traytoᵘur fals clerke qduod he
Thou shalte be dede be goddis deynte
Howe durste thou be so bolde to desparage
My doughter that is comen of so grete lynage
And bi the throte bolle he kaught Aleyne
And he hente hym dispitously ageyne
And on the nose he smote hym with his fyste
Doun̄ ranne the blode stremyng on his breste
And in the flore with mouthe and nose to broke
They wallowed as done pigges in a poke
And vp they gone and doun̄ ayein and that anoone
Till that the myln̉er fell at a stone
And doun̄ felle bakwarde on his wyfe
That wiste no thing of this nyse stryfe
For she was falle on a slepe a litell twyxte
With Iohn the clerke that waked all the nyght
And with that falle oute of hir slepe she breyde
Helpe hooly croys of bromholde she seide
In manus tuas to the lorde I calle
A wake Symkyn the fende is in this halle
Myn herte is broken helpe I am but dede
There lieth vppon my wombe and on my hede
Helpe Symkyn for the fals clerkes fight
This Iohn sterte vp as faste as he myght
And grasped be the walle too and froo
To finde a staf · and she stert vp also
And knewe the estes of the house bette than Iohn
And bi the walle she toke a staf anoone
And sawe a litell glȳmmeryng of light
For at an hole in shone the mone light
And bi that light she sawe hem bothe twoo
But sikerly she ne wiste who was who
But she sawe a white thing in hir Eye
And when she gan this white thing aspie
She wende the clerke hadde wered a volupere
And with a staf she drewe hym nere and nere
And wende forto haue hit this aleyn at the fulle
And smote this mylnere on the pilled sculle
And doun̄ he gothe and harowe he cried I deye
Thes clerkes bete hym wele and lete hym lye
And grette hym wele and toke her hors anoone
And eke her mele and home anoone they gone
And at the mylne dore they toke her cake
